title: Sikh community in mourning as 4 members were among victims of the Indianapolis mass shooting
He'd gone almost four years without a win, now he's a national hero
description: With one small putt, Hideki Matsuyama ascended from professional golfer to national treasure.

title: China's attempts to control the narrative on Xinjiang
Space is the final frontier for archaeologists
description: The boot prints left by Apollo 11 astronaut Neil Armstrong are a tangible legacy of one of humanity's greatest achievements -- putting a man on the moon.

title: Actor Felix Silla, famously known for his role as Cousin Itt on 'The Addams Family,' dies at 84
description: Actor Felix Silla, who portrayed Cousin Itt on the 1960s TV series "The Addams Family," died on Friday. He was 84.

title: Minneapolis and other US cities increase security ahead of Derek Chauvin trial verdict
description: With jury deliberations in Derek Chauvin's trial in the death of George Floyd expected next week, Minneapolis and other US cities are preparing for protests and possible civil unrest.

title: Biden says administration will raise refugee cap in first comments after Friday's back and forth
description: President Joe Biden said Saturday his administration will increase the refugee cap after a back and forth on Friday where the administration first announced it would keep the cap at the historically low level set by former President Donald Trump, before reversing course after facing blowback from refugee advocacy groups and Democrats in Congress.

title: 'I shut him down': Maxine Waters condemns Jim Jordan for 'bullying' Dr. Fauci
description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) got into a heated exchange with Dr. Anthony Fauci over the country's coronavirus mitigation measures, which ended with Rep. Maxine Waters (D-CA) telling Jordan to "shut your mouth." CNN's Jim Acosta spoke with Waters about why she intervened in the moment.

title: The US made little progress this week in preventing more Covid-19 deaths, an influential forecasting team says
description: As health experts worry about a Covid-19 resurgence, an influential forecasting team said the country did not make significant progress against the virus this week. And it warned about Americans taking fewer safety precautions.

title: Peloton Tread+ owners told to stop using the treadmill in 'urgent warning'
description: A US government agency issued an "urgent warning" for users of Peloton's Tread+ following multiple dangerous incidents with the machine, including a child's death.

title: Ohio teen arrested with AK-47 in Times Square subway station, police say
description: An 18-year-old from Ohio is facing weapons charges after officers patrolling a Times Square subway station on Friday found him with an AK-47 and a loaded magazine, police said.

title: Portland police disperse crowd with pepper spray following fatal officer-involved shooting
description: Police in Portland, Oregon, said they used pepper spray and smoke canisters to break up a crowd that gathered on Friday as they investigated the fatal shooting of a suspect by police in Lents Park.

title: Philippine authorities seize fossilized giant clam shells worth $25 million
description: The Philippines is shell-ebrating after it seized more than 150 tons of fossilized giant clams Friday worth nearly $25 million.

title: Queen sits alone at muted but emotional farewell for Prince Philip
description:
• Why the Queen had to sit alone
• Princes William and Harry walk together after funeral
• In pictures: Paying respects to Prince Philip
• Sign up for our royals newsletter

title: Princes William and Harry walk together after grandfather's funeral
description: Prince William and his brother Prince Harry set recent family frictions aside to walk together after attending the funeral service of their grandfather Prince Philip at Windsor Castle Saturday.

title: 'Enormously important': Foster on images of princes at funeral
description: CNN's Max Foster discusses the relationship between Prince William and Prince Harry who were seen together at Prince Philip's funeral for the first time since Harry's interview with Oprah.

title: Myanmar releases prisoners for New Year, though likely not dissidents
description: Authorities in Myanmar will release 23,184 prisoners from jails across the country on Saturday under a New Year amnesty, a Prisons Department spokesman said.

title: CNN anchor: We saw a Queen grieving
description: Queen Elizabeth II sat alone at her husband Prince Philip's funeral because of the UK's Covid-19 regulations. CNN's Julia Chatterley discusses.

title: Muted but emotional farewell for Prince Philip
Hamilton sees off the Red Bulls to seize his 99th pole
description: Lewis Hamilton celebrated his 99th Formula One pole position after seeing off Red Bull's Sergio Perez and Max Verstappen in qualifying for the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola on Saturday.

title: Quest to land humans on Mars heats up and 5 other top space and science stories this week
description: A version of this story appeared in Wonder Theory, the first-ever CNN space and science newsletter, which launched Saturday. Subscribe here and be among the first to receive the week's most fascinating stories, delivered straight to your inbox every Saturday morning.

title: Families of Americans held in Afghanistan and Russia worry about consequences of Biden's tough foreign policy moves
description: The sister of an American who was kidnapped in Afghanistan last year told CNN that she is worried that when the US troop withdrawal is complete, any leverage to get her brother home will vanish.

title: Princess Diana's chief of staff discusses funeral
description: Patrick Jephson, Princess Diana's chief of staff and personal secretary, says Prince Philip's funeral 'could be an opportunity to heal...or to make things worse.'

title: Smerconish: My tweet on mass shootings must have hit a nerve
description: CNN's Michael Smerconish says Americans are "resigned" to accept never-ending gun violence, after three mass shooting in three months.

title: White House backtracks on refugees decision after criticism and says Biden will announce increased cap by May 15
description: The White House said Friday President Joe Biden will set a new, increased refugee cap next month after facing a barrage of criticism when officials confirmed to CNN and other outlets that it would remain at the historically low level set by former President Donald Trump.

title: What is Dogecoin? How a joke became hotter than bitcoin
description: Dogecoin is the hottest, quirkiest cryptocurrency on the planet.

title: Hershey has a strange idea about where you should put your Reese's
description: Pieces of Reese's for your face. Beer going to the dogs. A sharper White Claw. Pizza that delivers itself.

title: Queen Elizabeth II bids goodbye to her late husband Prince Philip
Federal official: CDC, FDA taking reports of blood clots and J&J Covid-19 vaccine 'seriously'
description: US health agencies are taking concerns about blood clots and the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine "seriously" and are working to assess whether the shot is associated with a very small increased risk of rare blood clots, a federal official told CNN.

title: South Africa's tourism business struggle to hold on with few tourists in sight
description: One of Cape Town's highest rated restaurants may close its doors after receiving just one reservation in 2021 so far.

title: 60 years after the Bay of Pigs invasion, many Cuban Americans' distrust of the Democratic Party still affects national politics
Global Covid-19 death toll passes 3 million
description:
• Brazil asks women to delay pregnancy
• Doctors close in on cause of blood clots potentially linked with vaccines
• Trudeau warns Canada faces third wave
• The US may be kept from getting ahead of the pandemic, experts say

title: How a thunderstorm with the power of a hurricane capsized a ship
description: Nineteen people were on board a commercial ship when it capsized Tuesday during a thunderstorm off the Louisiana coast. But this was no ordinary storm.

title: The Order of Service in full
description: The funeral of Prince Philip, the late husband of Britain's Queen Elizabeth II, will take place on Saturday at St. George's Chapel in Windsor Castle.

title: Loneliness won't end when the pandemic ends
description: When the world goes back to normal, Shanan Cale's life won't change much.

title: Ramadan celebrations around the globe
description: In many parts of the Muslim world, the holy month of Ramadan began on Monday. For the second year in a row, practicing Muslims will observe the month during a pandemic -- a reality that will, again, disrupt age-old communal traditions for many.

title: NASA astronaut and two Russian cosmonauts have landed back on Earth
description: Just days after the International Space Station's crew reached 10 people, three have returned to Earth.

title: A student harnessed the power of beets to make healing from surgery safer
description: Dasia Taylor didn't expect to become a nationally recognized scientist at 17 years old.

title: Florida woman charged for allegedly threatening to kill Kamala Harris
description: A Miami woman has been charged for allegedly threatening to kill Vice President Kamala Harris, according to a criminal complaint filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida.

title: Matthew McConaughey: How actor's wife 'injected' soccer into his blood
description: Before he became one of Hollywood's leading men, before the Oscar for best actor in 2014 and he went Interstellar on the silver screen, Matthew McConaughey was learning his craft and, in fact, preparing to shoot his very first scene.

title: 2 transgender women killed in shootings at separate Charlotte hotels
description: Authorities have arrested two suspects in connection with the killings of two transgender women in Charlotte, North Carolina.
